title: [bug] bundler: deb package depends on umask value on build machine

labels.name: status: needs triage
labels.description: This issue needs to triage, applied to new issues

body:
### Describe the bug

When building a Debian package on a machine where `umask` is **not** `022`, the permissions used in the .deb are non-standard.


As reported by lintian, the **permissions on the control files** are an error. For other files, it's  only a warning (non-standard permissions); however, permissions on the target system should not depend on **`umask` on the build system**:
```
E: demo-tauri: control-file-has-bad-permissions 0664 != 0644 [md5sums]
W: demo-tauri: non-standard-dir-perm 0775 != 0755 [usr/]
W: demo-tauri: non-standard-dir-perm 0775 != 0755 [usr/bin/]
W: demo-tauri: non-standard-dir-perm 0775 != 0755 [usr/share/]
W: demo-tauri: non-standard-dir-perm 0775 != 0755 [usr/share/applications/]
W: demo-tauri: non-standard-dir-perm 0775 != 0755 [usr/share/icons/]
W: demo-tauri: non-standard-dir-perm 0775 != 0755 [usr/share/icons/hicolor/128x128/]
W: demo-tauri: non-standard-dir-perm 0775 != 0755 [usr/share/icons/hicolor/128x128/apps/]
W: demo-tauri: non-standard-dir-perm 0775 != 0755 [usr/share/icons/hicolor/256x256@2/]
W: demo-tauri: non-standard-dir-perm 0775 != 0755 [usr/share/icons/hicolor/256x256@2/apps/]
W: demo-tauri: non-standard-dir-perm 0775 != 0755 [usr/share/icons/hicolor/32x32/]
W: demo-tauri: non-standard-dir-perm 0775 != 0755 [usr/share/icons/hicolor/32x32/apps/]
W: demo-tauri: non-standard-dir-perm 0775 != 0755 [usr/share/icons/hicolor/]
W: demo-tauri: non-standard-executable-perm 0775 != 0755 [usr/bin/demo-tauri]
W: demo-tauri: non-standard-file-perm 0664 != 0644 [usr/share/applications/demo-tauri.desktop]
```

### Reproduction

On a Linux system:

1. Set umask different than `022`:
   ```
   $ umask 002
   ```
3. Build a Tauri application
4. Inspect the package, or run `lintian`.

### Expected behavior

Standard permissions should be used in the .deb package, regardless of `umask` value.

Probably:
- Control files: `0644`
- Data:
  - Binaries (main binary + sidecar binaries): `0755`
  - Directories: `0755`
  - Generated files (icons, .desktop file): `0644`
  - Copied files (resources and `deb > files`): copied from the source file, as it is currently

### Platform and versions
